title: Business Analyst / utvecklare
description:
För kunds räkning söker vi en Business Analyst / utvecklare med stort driv och engagemang som vill vara med och vidareutveckla ServiceNow-plattformen. Plattformen används av över 20 000 medarbetare och deras gemensamma mål är att skapa värdefulla och enkla interaktioner för alla dessa användare. Förvaltningen består av olika team baserat på produktområden där utvecklare, Business Analysts, UX-designers, Service Managers och en Service Owner ingår.
  
Uppdraget
  
  

**Några av arbetsuppgifterna:**  

Skapa och förvalta Business rules, Client scripts, Script includes, ACLs och integrationer.
  
Utveckla flöden i olika delar av ServiceNow.
  
Analysera krav och omsätta dessa till tekniska specifikationer.
  
Delta i workshops och dialoger med verksamheten och kunder.
  
  

**Exempel på produktområden:**  

**App Engine:** Skapa anpassade appar, ServiceNow Studio m.m.
  
**Platform:** Performance Analytics, CMDB, Instance Health m.m.
  
**SPM/APM:** Strategisk och applikationsportföljhantering.
  
  

Konsultens profil
  
Du som konsult kommer att utmanas av komplexa frågeställningar och förväntas samarbeta och skapa värdefull utveckling för vår kund. Dem arbetar agilt, så det är viktigt att trivas med det arbetssättet, ta egna initiativ och vara hjälpsam och serviceinriktad. Att ha ett analytiskt sinne, vara nyfiken på teknik samt kunna arbeta både med detaljer och helhetsperspektiv är mycket värdefullt.
  
  

**Vi söker följande erfarenhet:**  

Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
  
Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i ServiceNow.
  
Kunskaper i JavaScript.
  
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och automatisera flöden/processer i ServiceNow.
  
Vana av att hålla workshops och föra dialoger med verksamhet och kunder.
  
Erfarenhet av förvaltning, felsökning och incidenthantering.
  
  

**Det är ett plus om du har:**  

Erfarenhet av arbete i On-prem/Self-hosted miljöer.
  
Erfarenhet av att uppgradera ServiceNow.
  
Implementerat ServiceNow eller någon av dess moduler.
  
Erfarenhet av Camunda, Docusign, Blue Prism eller andra verktyg för automatisering av flöden.
  
  

**Relevanta certifieringar är också positivt, exempelvis:**  

Certified System Administrator (CSA)
  
Certified Application Developer (CAD)
  
Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) inom ITSM, HR eller andra moduler.
  
  

Ytterligare information
  
**Location:** Malmö
  
Detta är en projektanställning hos NXT Interim Malmö AB för perioden februari - oktober 2025. Vi tillämpar kollektivavtal. Vi utför säkerhetsprövning till många av våra tjänster, så även för denna. Därför behöver du vara svensk medborgare för att kvalificera dig.
  
Kunden erbjuder
  
För kunds räkning erbjuder vi en dynamisk och utmanande miljö där din kompetens värdesätts och utvecklas. Du blir en viktig del av ett team som skapar framtidens lösningar.
  
Låter detta som ett intressant uppdrag?
  
Sök redan idag så berättar vi mer! Vi behöver en ansökan, inkluderat CV, på svenska, som matchar vår kunds önskemål. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan då anbudstiden är kort.
  
NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag verksamt inom konsult- och rekryteringsbranschen. Vi arbetar inom HR, IT, Ekonomi, Sälj och Marknad och har över 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter förmåner som sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller vardagen.

title: Systemutvecklare till AFRY i Göteborg
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Som systemutvecklare kommer du tillhöra vår division som erbjuder tjänster och rådgivning inom digitalisering, artificiell intelligens, design med mera. Med hjälp av digitalisering hjälper vi våra kunder att snabba på omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.


Vill du arbeta med andra duktiga kollegor som är lika tekniskt intresserade som du? Hos AFRY får du möjlighet att arbeta på ett företag som sätter sina anställda först och som alltid strävar efter att ligga i framkant när det kommer till teknisk innovation med hållbarhet i fokus.


Vi har stora möjligheter för dig som har erfarenhet av systemutveckling och trivs i den omväxlande rollen som konsult. Vilket projekt som passar dig bäst avgörs utifrån din specifika kompetens och kunskap.


Kvalifikationer


* 3-4 års dokumenterad erfarenhet inom något/några av följande programmeringsspråk: .NET/C#, Java, eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av molntjänster så som AWS (Lambdas, Kinesis, ECS mm) eller Azure (Functions, App Services mm)
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av några av följande tekniker: .NET framework, .NET Core, Spring Framework, Microservices, Rest API: Databases (SQL / NoSQL), Git etc.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning.
* Permanent bosättning i Göteborg med omnejd.


Företagsbeskrivning


AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning.  

Vi är hängivna experter inom digitalisering, infrastruktur, industri och energi som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.


Ytterligare information


Omfattning: Heltid  

Start: Enligt överenskommelse  

Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande.  

  

Kontaktuppgifter vid frågor:  

  

Rekryterande chef  

Andreas Wikberger – andreas.wikberger@afry.com  

  

*Vi ber er respektera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail.*

*Under jul och nyår kan det ta lite längre tid att få svar eftersom vi har julledigt.*

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Developer
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Globalisation, digitalisation and mobility are examples of trends that are affecting our business environment. We are increasing our ability to make use of our information assets and utilize new technology. New possibilities enable us to share data with each other, apply machine learning and artificial intelligence.
   

  

 The work environment at Scania’s IT department is international and our employees are representing many different nationalities and countries. To this exciting and dynamic environment we are now looking for the following IT-professional.
   

  

**Your responsibility**
 You will join a DevOps team that, among other things, works with development and support for R&D. We work close to our customers and are involved in the entire system development process, from concept development to implementation and production. The team is responsible for projects and maintenance of current and future IT services that support Scania’s processes. You will play a central role in our DevOps team and will have many contacts around the Scania organisation. You will be involved in requirements, development, testing and release management. Together with the other teams, you will work in close cooperation with product and process owners on issues relating to functional guidelines – in both the short and long term.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are currently looking for someone who is passionate about agile working methods, loves development and enjoys the challenge of getting people and technology to function as a team to achieve optimal results. You also see opportunities for personal development in a technology-intensive global company.
   

  

**Do you enjoy working in a sociable and friendly atmosphere, are you down-to-earth and do you like sharing your skills? Then this may be the ideal opportunity for you!**
 We are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer! Scania uses the Dassault System's application portfolio, prior experience of the platform is a prerequisite. You have good knowledge in GitLab/Jenkins/Perforce. Experience from network side is meritorious You need to be proficient in written and spoken English, since it’s our corporate language.
   

  

 We expect that you also have:
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience of CATIA V5/ENOVIA/DELMIA/Dassault Systems platform.
* Good knowledge in CI/CD.
* Good knowledge of AIX system administration.
* Knowledge of Oracle databases.


**The location**
 Scania headquarter is located less than 40 km south of Stockholm city. It is easily accessible by regional train, commuter train, bus or car. Scania's own bus line, Scania Job Express, goes from Stockholm city directly to Scania in Sodertalje.
   

  

**We offer**
 In addition to exciting career and personnel development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, such as a company car, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply with your Cv and a Personal Letter with no later than 2025-01-12. For more information Please contact Anna-Carin Markström (Manager), anna-carin.markstrom@scania.com.
   

  

**About Scania and IT @ Scania**
 Scania is a part of Volkswagen Truck & Bus GmbH and one of the world´s leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications. Scania is also leading provider of industrial and marine engines. Service-related products account for a growing proportion of the company´s operations, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime. Scania also offers financial services.
   

  

 Scania’s IT organisation is an integrated part of the company providing products and services to all business units worldwide. Based on deep Scania business knowledge and internal relations we balance in-house core competences and service production with services externally sourced and governed by us. We are around 1500 people and the majority is located in Sodertalje.

title: Java Software Engineer (R-17098)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

 The Consumer Intelligence team is looking for a Software Developer, responsible for delivering smart data that help our customers make the right decisions.
   

  

 As part of the team, you will get the chance to provide platform components to deliver user facing experiences to consumers. We work closely with our customers to make sure we develop and build the right things.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Collaborate with a small, autonomous team of developers, and product owners to find end-to-end solutions to important problems.
* Implement these solutions in a microservice environment, built mostly on Kotlin and Spring Boot
* We work towards an architecture based on micro-services and REST APIs and with modern frameworks and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Spring Boot, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, Kafka, Docker and Kubernetes in AWS.
* Develop software that aims to meet the business goals and visions
* Ensure delivery of services that meet performance, scalability and robustness requirements
* Unit and integration tests for code and services produced
* Take part in the overall strategy for IT development


**Your Passion**
* You are passionate about development and being part of a real agile Tech organization. Our developers have great responsibility to participate and drive our products and services forward with high-end technology and customer experience. We work in product teams, in short sprints and with Continuous Deployment. We also work cross functional and cooperative across all the organization to manage and move towards our technical vision and platform to align in the future.
* Being part of our Tech organization, you are a social team player, curious and explorative, and want to take part in continuously improve the way we work and evaluating tools in the scope of open source and larger communities to best support our needs and vision.


**Who You Are**
* You hold a degree in computer science or similar subject and have at least 2+ years of working experience in similar engineering position
* You have an understanding of Java or Kotlin development
* Previous coding experience in object oriented or functional programming
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
* You have some knowledge of distributed systems, and be passionate about pair programming practices and agile way of working
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* You are fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
We are Telness Tech, a rapidly emerging startup/scaleup in the teltech space. Since our launch in 2021, our SaaS solution has provided the infrastructure, experience, and expertise that telecom companies need to revolutionize the consumer experience. Our cutting-edge technology removes the complexity and expense from the equation, leaving our customers free to make telecom a joyful experience.
   

  

 As we enter a phase of international growth, with customers across the Nordics, USA, and Europe, we are looking for Senior Software Engineers to help us become the global leader in
 *#teltech!*
**About The Role**
 You will work with a team of skilled engineers and build modern architecture and technology. Our backend is built in Golang and runs in AWS using Kubernetes. Communication between backend services uses gRPC, and the front end uses React. We use both GraphQL and REST and primarily PostgreSQL databases with event sourcing, supplemented by ClickHouse for specific use cases.
   

  

 As we are still in the early stages of building the platform, you will play a crucial role in shaping, designing, and building foundational components. As the company expands, you will help us with new, interesting challenges, scaling our platform from tens of thousands of users to hundreds and millions of users.
   

  

 We have openings in multiple teams, and hiring will be based on your background, skills, and technical interests. For the right person, there might also be opportunities to take on a leading technical role, whether from day one or over time - helping the team build a clear technical vision and make strategic technology choices as we scale.
   

  

**About You**
 We think you are an experienced Sr. Software Engineer who has probably worked at several companies, including at least one startup, and growing with them from an early stage. You are currently working with Go (or similar) in a backend-focused full-stack role and are comfortable diving into occasional front-end work with React. You are excited about joining a startup journey where you will shape both product and technology while working in a small, high-autonomy team.
   

  

**What We Look For**
* 5+ years as a backend/full-stack engineer in a modern tech environment.
* Strong experience with Go (Golang) and SQL (bonus for GraphQL, React, and Typescript).
* Ability to collaborate effectively and solve complex technical problems as a team.
* Passion for technology and excitement for the challenges of continuously adapting technology and working methods to support our scaling journey.
* Take ownership of your growth and support the development of others, eager to learn and share knowledge.
* Drives technical and process improvements, actively seeking ways to enhance technology and workflows, with a motivation to implement positive changes for both the team and the company.
* Autonomous, self-motivated, likes new challenges, and takes responsibility.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.


**What We Offer**
* Be part of a fun and inspiring startup journey with strong funding and international expansion
* An active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* Great team. Honestly – it's our main USP. We care deeply about each other and our customers.
* A proven product and business model ready to be refined and pushed globally.
* An opportunity to work with an innovative and highly regarded product that disrupts the industry.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’re encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities - for Telness Tech and yourself.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that promotes collaboration and positively challenges each other.
* Free daily breakfast, regular Friyay AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid work set up with an office in central Stockholm.


 Does this sound like you? Apply today!
   

  

***At this time, we are unable to support work permits or relocation.***

title: Product Developer / CAD Engineer
description:
**CAD Engineer/ Product developer for High-Tech Products**
 Are you a skilled and passionate Product developer /CAD engineer looking for a stimulating and diverse area of work? If so, NYFORS invites you to join our team of development engineers, mechanical engineers, and physicists dedicated to developing high-tech fiber processing equipment.
   

  

**THE TEAM**
 We are a skillful and passionate team with high competence in our area. The team includes development engineers, mechanical engineers and physicists all dedicated to developing new innovative, high-tech products and systems for fiber optic appplications.
   

  

 We think it’s exciting to see all parts come together, software and hardware, and see the end products be successfully used by our customers.
   

  

**THE POSITION**
 As a CAD engineer, you will have the opportunity to mix theory with practice and be responsible for evolving NYFORS' current product portfolio and developing completely new products.
   

  

 We work in SolidWorks and are looking for a civil engineer with a technical interest and a high sense of responsibility. The role requires accuracy and focus on results, and you should feel confident in your professional role, as you should be able to work independently.
   

  

 The work at NYFORS is cross-border and dynamic, and you will have the opportunity to work broadly and simultaneously both theoretically and practically. It is also an advantage if you have experience with various manufacturing processes.
   

  

**YOUR BACKGROUND**
 Ideally, you have worked as a CAD engineer for at least two-five years, with experience from different industries and insight into different manufacturing methods. Even younger engineers with the right profile have the opportunity for employment.
   

  

**WE CAN OFFER**
 At NYFORS, we offer versatile and stimulating work with the opportunity to develop and broaden your knowledge and skills. You will work in bright and pleasant premises at our head office in Skrubba, Stockholm, and we encourage a healthy work-life balance by offering our employees flexible working hours.
   

  

 We value diversity highly and have employees from five different countries. Our goal is to create a long-term, rewarding, and fun collaboration together with you.
   

  

**APPLICATION**
 If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your application as soon as possible. We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so please apply as soon as you can. However, the final application deadline is March15,2025. Your application should include your CV and a personal letter where you tell us more about who you are and how you can contribute to this role and to NYFORS as a company.
   

  

**About Nyfors**
 NYFORS is an innovative company moving at the fore-front of technology. As such we are looking for top applicants and strongly believe in investing in our employees. We encourage all our employees to develop the skills they are most interested in while working here. Our people are our strongest asset and what enables NYFORS’ continued success. Here you will get the opportunity to work with modern, high-tech equipment with dedicated co-workers.

title: System Developer
description:
**About Us**
 We are a tight agile team working cross-functionally with changes all across the development cycle, ranging from idea to an official release, with everything from requirements to implementation and final Safety tests in a true vehicle.
   

  

 The tasks span from pre-development and prototyping, through contributions to ongoing projects or analysis of field quality issues and rapid changes for addressing them.
   

  

 Integrating platform- and application-SW deliveries from other teams and creating continuous, system-tested COO releases are among our recurring main responsibilities.
   

  

 We value continuous improvements and an inventive work environment with a high degree of freedom. And we care for each other.
   

  

**About Our Product**
 The Coordinator (COO) system is the central control unit in Scanias trucks & buses, deployed in each produced vehicle.
   

  

 The COO reads and terminates the inputs from the driver such as the ignition key, buttons and pedals, as well as some other direct inputs and sensors connected, to create and distribute real-time signals and states to some consumers on vehicle level. COO also hosts real-time applications for several functions, such as sensor fusion, Advanced Emergency Braking and many ADAS- functions.
   

  

 Additionally, the COO terminates the external diagnostics-interface of the vehicle (the OBD connector) and safeguards some legacy ECUs from direct external diagnostics access.
   

  

**The position**
 We are now looking to strengthen our team with a system developer. In this role, you would work tightly with your colleagues, in all the phases of the software development. The work includes function specification and writing requirements, coding in C and test automation in Python. A small part is also within Matlab/Simulink. You will also take part in tests and investigations in test rigs and vehicles on our test track.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You probably have a few years of experience in working with embedded real-time systems as a developer in C, as a test developer working with tests in Python and HIL, or in the interaction between hardware and software.
   

  

 You love to work in a team, to support each other and to share struggles and success and you prefer to work with a product that has a real impact and matters to the customer. You feel excited and challenged to resolve technical problems whenever they arise and you like to laugh at work.
   

  

 You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc in the field of embedded systems, mechatronics, computer science, electronics, or relevant work experience. However, your attitude, mindset, and personality are of equal importance.
   

  

 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home a few days a week if the job allows. We can also provide you with an individual development plan that you create together with your manager, so you can reach your goals and receive the right support along the way.
   

  

 In addition to career and development opportunities, as an employee at Scania, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, performance bonuses, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more. Scania also organizes several events throughout the year where family and friends are always welcome, which is usually highly appreciated by everyone. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**For more information**
 For additional information about the position please contact:
   

  

 Johann Gårdebäck – Head of Central Coordination EESMC, johann.gardeback@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible as ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period and the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Looking forward to your application!

description:

* Är du riktigt vass på Next.js och React och älskar att resa på fritiden?
* Vill du bidra till att skapa den bästa kundresan & reseupplevelsen för våra kunder?
* Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare?



  





 Då är rollen som Senior frontendutvecklare på Apollo som klippt och skuren för dig, läs gärna vidare.
 



  





**Bakgrund** 




 För Apollo är utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss. Just nu arbetar vi med att byta ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful, samtidigt bygger vi en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare ges än större befogenheter och ansvar
 *för vår plattform.* 




 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen genom att driva innovation som hjälper våra kunder att hitta, konfigurera och beställa sin drömresa. Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med våra produktägare och UX designers driver gemensamt utvecklingen av sitt område framåt, både på produktnivå såväl som tekniskt. Vi arbetar nära övriga avdelningar för att säkerställa att vi på bästa sätt nyttjar den långa och breda erfarenhet vi som organisation har om de resor vi erbjuder.
 



 Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT. Vi tillämpar hybrid arbetsstil.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad frontendutvecklare (eller fullstackutvecklare med tonvikt frontend), för att lyckas väl i rollen så tror vi att du har:
 



  




* +5 års yrkesrelaterad erfarenhet med tonvikt på Next.js, React



  





 Det är starkt meriterande men inte ett krav om du även har erfarenhet av:
 


* C# .Net
* Contentful, gärna CMS och PIM
* Personifiering och Gamification.
* Continuous Integration
* Cloud Services som AWS eller Azure
* Terraform



  





**Personlighet** 




 Då utvecklingsteamet arbetar riktigt verksamhetsnära är förmågan till goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och Apollo är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du.
 



 Du är en nyfiken social och kreativ lagspelare, kompetent, kommunikativ och stolt över ditt yrkeskunnande. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback samt mån om att arbeta med kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som verksamheten.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Apollo erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv.
 



 Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och har utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas, tillsammans i teamen!
 



 Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner!
 



  





**Kontakt & Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult. Omar Burazerovic 0728–897441 / Lars Ohlson 0705-888175.
 



  





**Om Apollo** 




 Apollo är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel.
 



 Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland.
 



 Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.

title: Development Engineer Engine Control
description:
Join our Engine After-treatment Control team
   

  

 The group Engine After-treatment Control software, responsible for the functionality of our catalysts and particulate filters, is now looking to add another function developer to the team. Our work includes control and diagnostics of the exhaust after-treatment system in all of Traton’s powertrains and engine projects.
   

  

 Your work assignments
   

  

 You will be responsible for functionalities related to after-treatment components which you together with your supporting colleagues are going to follow up on and ensure that Traton has the best product possible. Every day you will meet new challenges and you will early on get to influence, both your daily work and long-term projects. You will be able to develop functionality in your area, while also helping other groups with their problems. You will be part of the whole development cycle, from concept development to legacy support.
   

  

 We work mainly with development in C and some model-based development using code generation through Simulink. An important part of the work is to develop analysis methods and models for the systems which we have responsibility for. We also test our functionality in bench as well as in vehicle.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
* You have experience working with the calibration of engines, catalysts, or particulate filters in engine test cells.
* You have experience and knowledge in software development. Coding in C and MATLAB/Simulink, as well as software testing, is an advantage.
* You like problem-solving and think creatively producing the most effective solution, and you have good communication skills.
* You also appreciate constantly improving tools and processes, which make the job more efficient.
* You have a Master’s degree in Engineering with a relevant specialization or someone with similar experience.
* You speak and write English. If you don't know Swedish you have a desire to learn it.


 But the most important thing is that you have the right attitude and are willing to learn new things.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 We offer an interesting and challenging job where there is plenty of scope for new ideas. Our corporate culture is characterized by openness, diversity, and respect for the individual. Employees are our most important resource, so we invest in training our employees and giving them the opportunity to broaden their skills in order to be able to grow with us.
   

  

 If you do not have a heavy-duty truck driving license (Swedish: C) today, you will have the chance to get it. Testing in trucks will support your SW verification.
   

  

 For more information
   

  

 Contact hiring manager Klara Lizarraga at e-mail: klara.lizarraga@scania.com
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If you are interested and feel that you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply!
   

  

 Selections and interviews will take place throughout the application period. Please apply no later than 2025-01-13.
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and degree certificate. Instead of a cover letter, please answer the questions stated when you submit your application. A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Data Engineer - Business intelligence developer to Scania
description:
Do you love working with loads of interesting data? Do you have a passion for data modelling? Are you excited to apply your technical skills to analyse data, and help Scania get new valuable insights from it? Then we would like to welcome you as a Data Engineer to our team at Scania!
   

  

*Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements. Be a part of this journey as a BI developer.*
*Our department plays a large role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver state of the art analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed the business goals.*
**YOU WILL**
 Be a part of a Squad consisting of BI developers and a Service Delivery Manager working with different organizations in Scania. You will be part of a very open and welcoming team’ that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create BI reports that bring value to our customers. You will have the possibility to work at least 3 days remotely per week.
   

  

 We work closely with business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs. We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high quality BI solutions including new projects as well as enhancing our existing portfolio with new requirements and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in both cloud and on prem. The cloud setup is AWS based with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on prem platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle based and SQL server on prem with Power BI as visualization tool. We are in a very exciting transition phase to move away from on prem into our highly capable cloud platform with hundreds of data sources and hundreds of reporting applications.
   

  

**IN ORDER TO SUCCEED IN THE ROLE, WE SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
* 4+years in PowerBI development (on Cloud + Report server) with good knowledge of working with Cloud Technologies (Snowflake) and support.
* 4+years’ experience in Developing Solutions for Data Analytics such as building semantic models.
* Strong DAX programming knowledge.
* Working experience with both low code and high code environments for ETL such as Matillion, ODI, DBT
* Deep knowledge about dimensional modelling, data access and data storage
* Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
* Experience of Tabular Editor and other BI/DW tools.
* Basic understanding on git branching, Push and Pull code to and from git repository
* Strong English language skills
* Involved in requirement gathering for reporting application and worked with customer
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience)


**WE SEE IT AS A BIG PLUS IF YOU HAVE ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:**
* You have experience from working with Logistics or Production or other relevant business area
* Experience and enjoyment of agile (JIRA) methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
* Snowflake/AWS Services experience
* Technical lead experience meriting


**Who Are You**
 You add energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team's development and are excited to drive improvements, within both processes and tools. You are a team player person who dares to take initiative and can easily adjust to different situations and working conditions. You are communicating fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, being able to understand requirements and analyse data. Meet users' expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. In addition, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!
   

  

**WE OFFER**
 We offer an exciting work environment where you develop and maintain the skills needed to meet future challenges, flexible working hours, great team spirit, working in a global organization. If you live in Stockholm we offer direct buss between Stockholm and Södertälje.
   

  

 If the above sounds like you, don’t hesitate to apply. We are interviewing continuously
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**FOR MORE INFORMATION**
 Please contact recruiting manager: Subhash Ghimire, e-mail: subhashchandra.ghimire@scania.com
   

  

 To apply, please use the provided link. We kindly request that applications not be submitted via email.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Business developer, Product introductions, Chassi & Cab
description:
Do you want to be an important part of our future?
   

  

 We are looking for a driven Business Developer to lead and manage process development projects within Scania and TRATON related to the product development process, ONE PDP. You will be part of an exciting journey, introducing a common module system for the entire group through a joint TRATON R&D-led flow landscape. Your role will involve developing, improving, and training our methods within ONE PDP for Production and Logistics.
   

  

**About Us**
 Our department is a central part of Scania P&L, Production & Logistics, responsible for leading, coordinating, and training in process and method development within the Product Development Process (ONE PDP). We work closely with several departments within Scania and TRATON to ensure a high level of knowledge and experience within the Product Development Process.
   

  

**Tasks**
* Lead the development and maintenance of common methods related to the PD process within both Scania P&L and TRATON.
* Educate employees to maintain a high level of PDP knowledge and experience within Scania P&L to create conditions for efficient production regarding safety, ergonomics, quality, delivery, and cost.
* Represent product introductions, chassis, and cab in the development and training of ONE PDP.
* Represent P&L in the forums we are active in.


**Your Profile**
 We are looking for someone who is passionate about their job and wants to lead our business in an unpretentious way, helping others to grow. You need to be comfortable working with feedback and challenging yourself, your team, colleagues, and decision-makers. As a person you are curious, driven, well-structured, can manage parallel assignments, and have good communication skills. Your interest in leadership and people is essential.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Good knowledge of PDP and related processes.
* Experience in leading and coordinating projects within product development.
* Relevant education from university and working experience within leadership (or similar).
* You communicate fluently in English both orally and in writing, and if you don't already speak Swedish you have a great ambition to learn.
* Experience working in a global organisation is a merit.


**We Offer**
* Development opportunities and training to strengthen your competence and career.
* Opportunity to work with committed and competent colleagues in various parts of the organisation.
* A dynamic and challenging work environment with the opportunity to influence and contribute to Scania's future development.
* An opportunity to broaden your network within TRATON.


**More Information**
 If you want more information about this position, don't hesitate to get in touch with Jonas Littorin, Manager Process Development, Product Introductions, email: jonas.littorin@scania.com
   

  

 During the Christmas holiday season, you can expect some delays in the replies. We hope for your understanding.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and copies of grades. Scania uses tests in the recruitment process. A background check may be conducted for this position. Selection and interviews will start in the second and third week of January. Apply via Career | Scania Group as soon as possible, but no later than January 12, 2025.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 If you are a Scania employee, you must log in and apply via MySuccess/Careers.

title: Business Developer for Packaging Process
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The Packaging Assortment & Selection Team (OAPB) is looking for a dynamic Business Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be crucial in the TRATON common PD process, focusing on developing and securing the future packaging selection process. You will collaborate with Production, Logistics, and Procurement to ensure seamless integration and efficiency. You will also lead and participate in projects aligning with future strategies of Scania and TRATON.
   

  

 As a Business Developer for Packaging Process your main responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Improving Processes: Find and implement ways to make packaging processes more efficient and sustainable, with the perspective of end-to-end
* Development Projects: Lead and participate in projects that improve and innovate our packaging logistics
* Global and Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with teams around the world, within difference functions, including in China, to develop and implement packaging solutions
* TRATON Integration: Collaborate within TRATON with a Group before Brand perspective
* Problem-Solving: Solve complex challenges by using different methods and solution strategies
* Strategy Contribution: Help shape and execute Scania's global packaging strategy, focusing on cost & sustainability


**Job Responsibilities**
 Your responsibilities and scope may change over time based on project and team needs. Initially, your main responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Contributing to cross-functional and cross-brand projects related to the packaging selection process
* Identifying, initiating, developing, and coordinating different development projects and assignments, including analysis and business case creation to propose the best way forward
* Solving problems and establishing new ways of working
* Contributing to our global Packaging Strategy


**Who You Are**
 You are an ambitious individual with good communication and relation-building skills. Your structured approach and can do-attitude, will enable you to collaborate effectively with different stakeholders for a positive outcome. Furthermore, you share knowledge and have the ability to positively influence others.
   

  

 We also believe that you:
   

  

  

* Have a University degree (or comparable), preferably within Mechanical Engineering, Supply Chain Management, or similar
* Have work experience within logistics or procurement e.g. supply chain analyst, supply chain development, and/or a project management focused role
* Easily see the bigger picture, understand the details and see opportunities for continuous improvement
* Are enthusiastic and like to work in a fast-changing environment, you are triggered by challenges
* Keeping deadlines and reaching goals is important to you
* Are skilled when it comes to organizing and planning
* Are familiar with accomplishing consequence analysis and creating business cases
* Are skilled within Excel, Power BI or similar analytics tools and base your solutions on facts & data
* Are comfortable building and maintaining relationships, both within and outside the organization
* Are fluent in English, both written and spoken


**This Is Us**
 OAP – Packaging Development is responsible for shaping Scania's global packaging strategy. Our ambition is to lead in sustainable logistics, optimizing our logistics flows from a packaging perspective. We strive to ensure minimal environmental impact, high quality, and minimal total logistics costs in our supply chain. As part of the TRATON Group, we collaborate closely with other brands to maximize our collective potential.
   

  

 OAPB Packaging Assortment & Selection is responsible for three areas: packaging process development, developing & maintaining the common packaging assortment, as well as packaging selection for specific areas. With a global perspective, including Scania's operations in China and within the TRATON framework, we are constantly evolving to support new business initiatives and IT developments.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-08. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Sofia Nilsson Manager Packaging Assortment, Sele, sofia.x.nilsson@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Logistics Developer - Battery Production
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Join our Logistics Engineering and Development department as a Logistics Developer for Automatic storages. You will support the material flow to produce Modules, Battery packs, and Electrical Cables Harnesses, which are key components for our electrical vehicles. Our material handling process features various automated equipment for Production and Logistics, including automatic storages, AGVs, and robots.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Plan, lead, and follow up on activities and projects for the logistics process in our stream.
* Monitor developments within Production and Logistics and contribute to introducing new technologies.
* Actively participate in assigned forums and gather improvement suggestions for the business.
* Communicate at different levels within Scania's organization.
* Identify improvements and suggest necessary changes.
* Calculate investment and resource needs for assigned projects.
* Drive major improvement activities to develop working methods, methods, and processes.
* Work daily with the Warehouse Control System, steering all three automatic storages, and closely support operations with processes, deviations, and improvements.


**Who You Are**
* You possess an academic background in Production and Logistics or a related field.
* You have previous experience with operational and personal responsibility, preferably in a Production or Logistics environment.
* You communicate effectively in both Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
* You have a strong passion for Production and Logistics, and you constantly strive to develop yourself, others, and our working methods to achieve set goals.
* You are engaged, curious, and well-structured.
* You work with resilience and a supportive attitude.


**This Is Us**
 Logistics encompasses several key functions: production planning, material planning, material handling, logistics development, and logistics technology. Most processes in production and material handling are automated, with flows that are highly interconnected. Nothing moves without signals within and between our IT systems, and material handling processes are largely automated with high-bay warehouses, buffers, and AGVs.
   

  

 Our team specializes in Logistics Engineering and development, focusing on launching and operating our new plant. Some of us are also exploring the next steps in our electrification journey. We believe that open-mindedness and teamwork are crucial to our success. Our processes are strongly interconnected, and we are working to establish a common understanding of our current position and future direction.
   

  

 We are an international team with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and competencies. This diversity brings different perspectives, which strengthens our approach to tackling and solving challenges. Our team fosters an open and inclusive environment where everyone is encouraged to share their opinions, which is highly valued and supports our work.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-05. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Manager Logistics Engineering, mail: alexander.classon@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Junior Nuclear Safety Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about nuclear safety and eager to kick-start your career in an innovative industry? Do you have a knack for technical writing and a desire to learn from experienced engineers? Join Blykalla, Sweden’s leader in Small Modular Reactors (SMRs), as a
 **Junior Nuclear Safety Engineer** 
 , and contribute to shaping the future of sustainable energy.
   

  

**What We Do At Blykalla**
*At Blykalla, we’re transforming the future of nuclear power by developing innovative Small Modular Reactors (SMRs). Our mission is to create a new generation of nuclear energy systems that are safer, more efficient, and environmentally friendly. As Sweden’s only developer of SMRs, we’re at the forefront of a groundbreaking industry.*
**What You’ll Get To Do**
 As a Junior nuclear safety engineer for SAR document production, you will play a vital role in preparing the First Preliminary Safety Analysis Report (FPSAR) for Blykalla’s SEALER reactors. This document is a cornerstone of the licensing process, ensuring our reactors meet the stringent safety standards set by regulatory authorities. This is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about nuclear safety and eager to grow in a supportive, innovative environment. You will be working closely with more experienced Safety engineers for SAR production and supporting our design team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Assist in drafting, editing, and organizing sections of the FPSAR, including reactor design, safety systems, and risk mitigation strategies.
* Review safety-related documentation and other design documentation.
* Interpretation of authority requirements from the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority (SSM) and international nuclear safety requirements and standards.
* Support and produce documentation for safety analyses, accident scenarios, and operational parameters for our SEALER reactors.
* Stay updated on regulatory changes and integrate them into Blykalla documentation.


**Who You Are**
 You will be part of a highly skilled team with a can-do attitude. We value Team chemistry and strive to create a workplace that you enjoy coming to. There are however a few things that we think will help you to succeed in this role, these are:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in nuclear engineering, physics, or a related field.
* Strong written communication skills, preferably with some technical writing experience.
* Basic understanding of nuclear safety principles, reactor operations, or licensing processes is a plus.
* Detail-oriented, organized, and eager to learn.
* Fluent in the English language, both in speech and writing
* Fluency in the Swedish language, both in speech and writing


 Meritorious skills:
   

  

* Experience from energy companies, research institutions, or nuclear-focused organizations, with tasks that involve compiling, analyzing, or presenting technical data.
* Experience writing or contributing to detailed technical documents such as research papers, design reports, or engineering summaries.
* Familiarity with regulatory or standards-based documentation (SAR), even if indirectly (e.g., coursework requiring structured report writing).


**Location**
 This position is for our office in Stockholm.
   

  

**So, what do you think?**
 Become part of a team that’s transforming nuclear energy and building a sustainable future. Together, we’ll deliver safe, clean, and reliable power to the world.
   

  

 We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about power supply!
   

  

*Note: We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and are an equal-opportunity employer.*
**Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications over email.**
 We are not open to external help from recruitment agencies.

title: Business Intelligence Developer Data Ingestion
description:
**Please not that working proficiency in Swedish language is required.** 




  




* Är du riktigt vass på BI Utveckling & Data Ingestion samt älskar att resa på fritiden?
* Vill du bidra till att skapa den bästa kundresan & reseupplevelsen för våra kunder?
* Vill du arbeta i en familjär, varm och omtänksam företagskultur ihop med dedikerade och riktigt kompetenta medarbetare?



  





 Då är rollen som BI Developer - Data Ingestion Specialist på Apollo som klippt och skuren för dig, läs gärna vidare!
 



  





 Apollo söker nu en skicklig BI-utvecklare till vårt datalagerteam, som främst fokuserar på datainmatningsfasen. Den idealiska kandidaten kommer att spela en avgörande roll när det gäller att skapa och underhålla vår datapipeline, vilket säkerställer ett sömlöst dataflöde från olika källor till vårt Azure Databricks-informationslager.
 



  





**Bakgrund** 




 För Apollo är utveckling lika viktigt som Grekland och världen. Att utveckla tjänster och produkter som ger våra slutkunder den bästa upplevelsen, innan, under och efter resan är ständigt i fokus för oss. Just nu arbetar vi med att byta ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful, samtidigt bygger vi en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare ges än större befogenheter och ansvar för vår plattform.
 



 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen genom att driva innovation som hjälper våra kunder att hitta, konfigurera och beställa sin drömresa. Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med våra produktägare och UX designers driver gemensamt utvecklingen av sitt område framåt, både på produktnivå såväl som tekniskt. Vi arbetar nära övriga avdelningar för att säkerställa att vi på bästa sätt nyttjar den långa och breda erfarenhet vi som organisation har om de resor vi erbjuder.
 



 Tjänsteplacering kommer att vara på huvudkontoret på Ynglingagatan i Stockholm, här sitter ca 170 av våra medarbetare varav 50 av dessa jobbar inom IT.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 



* Designa, utveckla och underhålla datainmatningsprocesser från flera plattformar (AWS, Google osv.) och databaser (SQL Server, Oracle) till vår Azure Databricks-miljö.
* Skriva effektiva och skalbara Pythonscript och SQL-frågor för dataextraktion, transformation och inläsning (ETL).
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå datakrav och implementera lämpliga intagslösningar.
* Felsöka och optimera processer för datainmatning för förbättrad prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad med best practice och den senaste utvecklingen inom datainmatningsteknik.



  





**Nödvändiga färdigheter** 



* Minst 2-3 års erfarenhet av nedan, gärna mer
* Starka kunskaper i Python-programmering och SQL.
* Omfattande erfarenhet av datainmatning från olika källor, inklusive molnplattformar och relationsdatabaser.
* Gedigen förståelse för ETL-processer och datalagringskoncept.
* Kunskaper om Azure Databricks och andra molnbaserade dataplattformar.
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga och analytisk förmåga.
* God Svenska och Engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Meriteriande färdigheter** 



* Erfarenhet av datamodellering och övergripande datalagerprocesser.



  





**Personlighet** 




 Då utvecklingsteamen arbetar verksamhetsnära är förmågan till goda relationer samt stort intresse för övriga delar av Apollo viktigt. Apollo andas och lever tillsammans, lagandan är tydlig och man utmanar gärna varandra positivt för att nå framgång. Branschen och Apollo är snabbrörliga, agila och så även du. Vidare är du en nyfiken social och kreativ lagspelare, kompetent, kommunikativ och stolt över ditt yrkeskunnande. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, är bra på att ge och ta konstruktiv feedback samt mån om att arbeta med kontinuerlig förbättring av såväl dig själv som verksamheten.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Apollo erbjuder en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och delande av idéer inom och mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktigt samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv. Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och har utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas, tillsammans i teamen! Utöver detta kommer du givetvis att erbjudas riktigt bra deals på resor utöver redan schyssta förmåner!
 



  





**Kontakt & Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company. Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med att skicka in ditt CV. Vid intresse vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Omar Burazerovic på 0728–897441.
 



  





**Om Apollo** 




 Apollo är en branschledande researrangör som underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen, först med resor till Grekland till att nu kunna erbjuda hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel. Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler kompetenta IT-medarbetare som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland. Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.
